intro: Antennaria neodioica var. grandis, commonly known as the grand Antennaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features small, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine white or gray pubescence. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and open woodlands. Antennaria neodioica var. grandis is a perennial species that is native to parts of Europe and Asia.
